task_summary: The robot identifies a mug, moves above and aligns, pours liquid into the mug from a cup, and then safely retreats.

task_long_description.overview: This episode depicts a robot arm executing a pouring task at a laboratory bench. The robot first visually locates a mug, approaches and aligns the end-effector holding a cup above it, and executes a precise pouring motion with a controlled tilt. After completing the pour, the arm retreats from the mug to a safe position. Accurate perception, precise alignment, and smooth controlled motion are essential to ensure a successful pour without spillage.
preconditions: Mug is placed on table, visible in workspace
Robot is holding a cup with source liquid
No obstructions between robot and mug
stepwise_plan: Check for visibility of the mug
Move to a pose above the mug
Approach and align with the mug opening
Pour contents from the cup into the mug with precise tilt
success_criteria: Liquid is transferred into the mug with minimal or no spillage
Robot stays clear of collision with mug and table
Cup contents are depleted or pour is complete
failure_and_recovery: If mug is not detected, perform object detection
If approach or alignment fails, retry or fallback to perceptual reacquisition
If pour fails (liquid missed), abort and alert operator
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when pour is complete and robot is safely retreated from mug.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the mug is visible in the workspace
Detects the mug if not already visible
Moves the arm above the mug
Approaches and aligns above the mug opening
Pours contents from the cup into the mug
Retreats the robot arm to a safe distance after pouring

recovery_strategy: Retry object detection if mug not visible
Abort and alert if collision or pour fails
assumptions: The cup is already grasped by the robot at episode start (since no Pick is observed in frames)
Frames show a direct approach and pour without perceptual or grasp recovery
The mug is the only plausible target as per instruction and visual evidence

expected_success_criteria: Contents transferred from cup to mug with minimal spillage
Robot arm avoids collisions, completes retreat
